translated: That is his eye.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig de dang ldan pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig de dang ldan pas /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has that eye

original: rnam pa thams cad du ma mthong ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ma mthong ba'am /
translated: does not see anything at all that is not seen,

original: ma thos pa'am /🔽ma shes pa'am /
analyzed: ma thos pa'am / ma shes pa'am /
translated: does not hear anything at all that is not heard,

original: khong du ma chud pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: khong du ma chud pa gang yang med de /
translated: does not know anything at all that is not known,🔽and does not comprehend anything at all that is not comprehended.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mig yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mig yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: this is the purified eye of the Buddha of the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig lnga yongs su sbyang par 'dod pa dang / thob par 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig lnga yongs su sbyang par 'dod pa dang / thob par 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Thus, Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings who want to purify the five eyes and want to attain them should make an effort in the six perfections.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: 'di @253a *// ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug tu dge ba'i chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med de /
analyzed: 'di @253a *// ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug tu dge ba'i chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med de /
translated: It is because all wholesome dharmas are included in the six perfections.

original: nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med do //
translated: All the dharmas of śrāvakas, all the dharmas of pratyekabuddhas, all the dharmas of bodhisattvas, and all the dharmas of buddhas are included in them.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: la la zhig yang dag par smra bas /
analyzed: la la zhig yang dag par smra bas /
translated: if someone who is speaking correctly

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus zhes brjod pa zhig tu dgos na; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par smra bas brjod do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus zhes brjod pa zhig tu dgos na; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par smra bas brjod do //
translated: were to say, ‘All wholesome dharmas are included,’ they would be speaking correctly about the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mig lnga skyed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mig lnga skyed pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom gives rise to the five eyes.

original: mig lnga po de dag la bslab pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: mig lnga po de dag la bslab pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who train in those five eyes will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu 'thob ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu 'thob ste /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this perfection of wisdom attain the perfection of higher knowledge.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: They experience many kinds of miracles.

original: de ni sa chen po 'di'ang rab tu g-yo bar byed do //🔽gcig tu gyur cing mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni sa chen po 'di'ang rab tu g-yo bar byed do // gcig tu gyur cing mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: They cause this great earth to quake.🔽They become one and become many.

original: mang por gyur cing gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang por gyur cing gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: They become many and become one.

original: snang ba dang mi snang ba'ang nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: snang ba dang mi snang ba'ang nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: They experience being visible and invisible.

original: rtsig pa las thal ba dang / ra ba las thal ba dang / ri las thal bar thogs pa med pa'i lus kyis 'gro ste /
analyzed: rtsig pa las thal ba dang / ra ba las thal ba dang / ri las thal bar thogs pa med pa'i lus kyis 'gro ste /
translated: He goes through walls, through ramparts, through mountains, through

original: dper na / nam mkha' la'ang skyil mo @253b krung gis 'gro ste /🔽dper na / 'dab chags bya bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' la'ang skyil mo @253b krung gis 'gro ste / dper na / 'dab chags bya bzhin no //
translated: hills, with his body unimpeded as though through space.

original: sa la'ang gyen du 'byung ba dang / 'og tu 'dzul ba byed do //
analyzed: sa la'ang gyen du 'byung ba dang / 'og tu 'dzul ba byed do //
translated: He even goes cross-legged through the sky,

original: dper na / chu la bya ba bzhin no //🔽chu la'ang 'bying ba med par 'gro ste /
analyzed: dper na / chu la bya ba bzhin no // chu la'ang 'bying ba med par 'gro ste /
translated: like a bird with wings.🔽He dives in and out of the earth as though in water.

original: dper na / sa la bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / sa la bya ba bzhin no //
translated: He walks on water without sinking as though on earth.

original: du bar 'thul zhing mer 'bar te /
analyzed: du bar 'thul zhing mer 'bar te /
translated: He emits smoke and fire from his body,

original: dper na / me'i phung po chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / me'i phung po chen po bzhin no //
translated: like a great fire with a mass of flames.🔽He even touches and strokes with his hand the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful, and controls with his body as far as the Brahma world.

original: nyi ma zla ba 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che la 'di ltar mthu che zhing 'di ltar dbang che ba dag kyang lag pas byugs shing tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang bsgyur te rdzu 'phrul des rlom sems su 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che la 'di ltar mthu che zhing 'di ltar dbang che ba dag kyang lag pas byugs shing tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang bsgyur te rdzu 'phrul des rlom sems su 'gyur ba med do //
translated: But he does not become intoxicated with that superknowledge.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why not?

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dben pa dang / rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir des rdzu 'phrul gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul de lta bu mi dmigs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dben pa dang / rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir des rdzu 'phrul gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul de lta bu mi dmigs te /
translated: Because they are empty of inherent nature, isolated from inherent nature, and not arisen by way of their own inherent nature, they do not apprehend any magical power by means of which they would become conceited.

original: de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par rdzu 'phrul lam rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do //
analyzed: de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par rdzu 'phrul lam rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do //
translated: Except for keeping in mind the knowledge of all aspects, they do not even give rise to the thought of magical power or the accomplishment of magical power.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: in this way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom, they actualize the wisdom that realizes the supernormal knowledge of the modes of magical power.

original: de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas lha dang mi gnyis ka'i sgra thos te /
analyzed: de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas lha dang mi gnyis ka'i sgra thos te /
translated: With their divine ear, which surpasses the human ear, they hear both divine and human sounds, whether near or far.

original: lha'i rna ba'i khams des bdag ni sgra nyan ces bya bar rlom sems su 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i khams des bdag ni sgra nyan ces bya bar rlom sems su 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That divine ear does not become conceited, thinking, ‘I hear sounds.’

original: de ni 'di ltar des rang bzhin stong pa dang / rang bzhin dben @254a *//
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar des rang bzhin stong pa dang / rang bzhin dben @254a *//
translated: Because it is empty of an intrinsic nature, it is isolated from an intrinsic nature, and it is non-arisen.

original: pa dang / rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir rna ba dang sgrar dmigs pa med de /🔽de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par lha'i rna ba'i khams la bsam pa'ang mi skyed do //
analyzed: pa dang / rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir rna ba dang sgrar dmigs pa med de / de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par lha'i rna ba'i khams la bsam pa'ang mi skyed do //
translated: It does not apprehend an ear and sounds.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Except for the application of the knowledge of all aspects, it does not even think of the divine ear.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe lha'i rna ba'i khams mngon du bya pa'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe lha'i rna ba'i khams mngon du bya pa'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom are accomplishing the knowledge of the superknowledge that realizes the divine ear,

original: des sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: des sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: they know the minds of other beings and other persons as they really are.

original: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with passion as a mind with passion.🔽He knows as it really is a mind without passion as a mind without passion.

original: zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems la zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems la zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with aversion as a mind with aversion.

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems la zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems la zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so /
translated: He knows as it really is a mind without aversion as a mind without aversion.

original: gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems la gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems la gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with confusion as a mind with confusion.

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems la gti mug @254b dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems la gti mug @254b dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that a mind free from delusion is a mind free from delusion.

original: sred pa dang ldan pa'i sems la sred pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sred pa dang ldan pa'i sems la sred pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that a mind with craving is a mind with craving.

original: sred pa dang bral ba'i sems la sred pa dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sred pa dang bral ba'i sems la sred pa dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that a mind free from craving is a mind free from craving.

original: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i sems la nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i sems la nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that a mind with grasping is a mind with grasping.

original: nye bar len pa med pa'i sems la nye bar len pa med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa'i sems la nye bar len pa med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that a mind without grasping is a mind without grasping.

original: kun nas 'dus pa'i sems la kun nas 'dus pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: kun nas 'dus pa'i sems la kun nas 'dus pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows a contracted mind as it really is as a contracted mind.

original: rnam par 'phros pa'i sems la rnam par 'phros pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rnam par 'phros pa'i sems la rnam par 'phros pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows a distracted mind as it really is as a distracted mind.🔽He knows an exalted mind as it really is as an exalted mind.

original: rgya chung ba'i sems la rgya chung ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rgya chung ba'i sems la rgya chung ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows an unexalted mind as it really is as an unexalted mind.

original: rgya che ba'i sems la rgya che ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rgya che ba'i sems la rgya che ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows a surpassed mind as it really is as a surpassed mind.🔽He knows an unsurpassed mind as it really is as an unsurpassed mind.

original: yangs pa'i sems la yangs pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽che bar gyur pa'i sems la che bar gyur pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu @255a *//
analyzed: yangs pa'i sems la yangs pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽che bar gyur pa'i sems la che bar gyur pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu @255a *//
translated: He knows a concentrated mind as it really is as a concentrated mind.🔽He knows an unconcentrated mind as it really is as an unconcentrated mind.🔽He knows a liberated mind as it really is as a liberated mind.🔽He knows an unliberated mind as it really is as an unliberated mind.

original: shes so // tshad med pa'i sems la tshad med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: shes so // tshad med pa'i sems la tshad med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows immeasurable minds as they are in reality as immeasurable minds.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems la mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems la mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows concentrated minds as they are in reality as concentrated minds.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows unconcentrated minds as they are in reality as unconcentrated minds.

original: rnam par grol ba'i sems la rnam par grol ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i sems la rnam par grol ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows liberated minds as they are in reality as liberated minds.

original: rnam par ma grol ba'i sems la rnam par ma grol ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rnam par ma grol ba'i sems la rnam par ma grol ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows unliberated minds as they are in reality as unliberated minds.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems la zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems la zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that a defiled mind is defiled.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems la zag pa med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems la zag pa med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that an undefiled mind is undefiled.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sems la nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sems la nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that a mind with the outflows is a mind with the outflows.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems la nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems la nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that a mind without the outflows is a mind without the outflows.

original: bla na yod pa'i sems la bla na yod pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: bla na yod pa'i sems la bla na yod pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that a surpassable mind is a surpassable mind.

original: bla na med pa'i sems la @255b bla na med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes to /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sems la @255b bla na med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes to /
translated: He knows as it really is that an unsurpassable mind is an unsurpassable mind.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa des rlom sems su 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa des rlom sems su 'gyur ba med do //
translated: and that knowledge of the minds of others does not lead to conceit.🔽Because that mind itself is inconceivable.

original: de ni / 'di ltar sems de nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar sems de nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir te /
translated: It does not lead to conceit in the thought,

original: de ni / bdag gis shes so //🔽zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: de ni / bdag gis shes so // zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: ‘I know that mind.’

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa dang / rang bzhin dben pa dang / rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa dang / rang bzhin dben pa dang / rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems mi dmigs te /
translated: Because a mind that would lead to conceit is not apprehended, since its nature is empty, its nature is isolated, and its nature is non-arisen.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par sems shes par bya ba'i bsam pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par sems shes par bya ba'i bsam pa'am /
translated: Except for the application of mind to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: sems shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do //
analyzed: sems shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do //
translated: he does not even give rise to the thought of knowing the mind, or the thought of accomplishing the knowledge of the mind.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / spyod pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / spyod pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: He accomplishes the knowledge of the superknowledge that perceives the minds and conduct of all sentient beings.

original: de ni / sngon kyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes rnam pa du ma mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: de ni / sngon kyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes rnam pa du ma mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: He accomplishes the knowledge of the superknowledge that perceives past lives in many ways.

original: sems gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas sems brgya'i par du'ang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: sems gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas sems brgya'i par du'ang rjes su dran no //
translated: He remembers one mind, up to he remembers a hundred minds.

original: nyi ma gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas nyi ma brgya'i bar du'ang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: nyi ma gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas nyi ma brgya'i bar du'ang rjes su dran no //
translated: He remembers one day, up to he remembers a hundred days.

original: zla ba gcig rjes su dran pa nas zla ba brgya'i bar du'ang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: zla ba gcig rjes su dran pa nas zla ba brgya'i bar du'ang rjes su dran no //
translated: He remembers one month, up to he remembers a hundred months.

original: lo gcig rjes su dran pa nas lo brgya'i par du'ang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: lo gcig rjes su dran pa nas lo brgya'i par du'ang rjes su dran no //
translated: He remembers one year, up to he remembers a hundred years.

original: bskal pa gcig rjes su dran pa nas bskal pa brgya'i bar du'ang rjes @256a *//🔽su dran no //
analyzed: bskal pa gcig rjes su dran pa nas bskal pa brgya'i bar du'ang rjes @256a *// su dran no //
translated: He remembers one eon, up to he remembers a hundred eons.

original: bskal pa brgya phrag du ma'ang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: bskal pa brgya phrag du ma'ang rjes su dran no //
translated: He remembers many hundreds of eons.

original: bskal pa stong phrag du ma'ang rjes su dran no //🔽bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma'ang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: bskal pa stong phrag du ma'ang rjes su dran no // bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma'ang rjes su dran no //
translated: I remember many thousands of eons.🔽I remember many hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'ang rjes su dran te /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'ang rjes su dran te /
translated: I remember many quintillions of eons.

original: bdag de lta bu zhig na 'dug 'dug ste /
analyzed: bdag de lta bu zhig na 'dug 'dug ste /
translated: I was staying there,

original: ming ni / 'di zhes bya /🔽rus ni / 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: ming ni / 'di zhes bya / rus ni / 'di zhes bya /
translated: with such and such a name,🔽such and such a family,

original: rigs ni / 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rigs ni / 'di zhes bya /
translated: such and such a caste,

original: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: eating such and such food,

original: yun ni / 'di srid cig tu 'dug 'dug /🔽tshe'i mtha' ni /
analyzed: yun ni / 'di srid cig tu 'dug 'dug / tshe'i mtha' ni /
translated: staying for such and such a time,🔽with such and such a lifespan,

original: 'di tsam zhig tu gyur ste; de ltar bdag de nas shi 'phos nas ni che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //🔽zhes bya ba nas de nas shi 'phos nas ni /
analyzed: 'di tsam zhig tu gyur ste; de ltar bdag de nas shi 'phos nas ni che ge mo zhig tu skyes so // zhes bya ba nas de nas shi 'phos nas ni /
translated: and after dying there I was born here.

original: 'dir skyes so //🔽zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam pa dang bcas /🔽gtan tshigs dang bcas /
analyzed: 'dir skyes so // zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam pa dang bcas / gtan tshigs dang bcas /
translated: I died there and was born here.🔽In this way, with its aspects and particulars, I remember my many past abodes.

original: dan rtags dang bcas par bdag dang gzhan gyi gnas rnam pa du mar rjes su dran te /
analyzed: dan rtags dang bcas par bdag dang gzhan gyi gnas rnam pa du mar rjes su dran te /
translated: I remember my many past abodes with their aspects and particulars.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes des kyang rlom sems du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes des kyang rlom sems du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: The wisdom of the supernormal knowledge that manifests the recollection of past lives does not become conceited.

original: de ni / 'di ltar ye shes de ye shes ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar ye shes de ye shes ma yin te /
translated: Because that wisdom is not wisdom.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inconceivable.

original: de ni / bdag gis rab tu shes so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: de ni / bdag gis rab tu shes so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: It does not become conceited, thinking, ‘I know this.’

original: 'di ltar des ye shes de nyid kyang rang bzhin stong pa dang / rang bzhin dben pa dang / rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ye shes mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des ye shes de nyid kyang rang bzhin stong pa dang / rang bzhin dben pa dang / rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ye shes mi dmigs so //
translated: Because that wisdom does not apprehend any wisdom that would become conceited, since that wisdom itself is empty of essence, is isolated in its essence, and is non-arisen by its essence.

original: de ni / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par rjes su dran pa'i ye shes kyi don du @256b bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do //
analyzed: de ni / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par rjes su dran pa'i ye shes kyi don du @256b bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do //
translated: Except for the attention of omniscience, he does not even give rise to the thought of the wisdom of recollection.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra!

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they accomplish the knowledge of the superknowledge that actualizes the recollection of past lives.

original: de ni / lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas /
analyzed: de ni / lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas /
translated: With their divine eye, which is pure and surpasses the human,

original: sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa dang / bzang pa dang / ngan pa dang / ngan song na gnas pa dang / bde 'gro na gnas pa dag kyang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa dang / bzang pa dang / ngan pa dang / ngan song na gnas pa dang / bde 'gro na gnas pa dag kyang rab tu shes te /
translated: they know the deaths and rebirths of beings, their good and bad complexions, their good and bad destinies, and whether they are going to good or bad rebirths.

original: sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: They know that these beings🔽have bad physical conduct,

original: lus kyis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan; ngag gis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan /
analyzed: lus kyis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan; ngag gis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan /
translated: bad verbal conduct,

original: yid kyis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yid kyis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: and bad mental conduct.

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa /
translated: They disparage the noble ones

original: log par lta ba rnams te /
analyzed: log par lta ba rnams te /
translated: and have wrong views.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas ngan song dang / ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas ngan song dang / ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye'o //
translated: Due to this cause and this condition, when their bodies have perished, they are reborn in the lower realms, in the evil destinies, in the hells.

original: sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: “These sentient beings

original: lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan /
analyzed: lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan /
translated: have engaged in good conduct with their bodies,

original: ngag gis legs par spyod pa dang ldan /
analyzed: ngag gis legs par spyod pa dang ldan /
translated: have engaged in good conduct with their speech,

original: yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: have engaged in good conduct with their minds,

original: 'phags pa la skur pa mi 'debs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa la skur pa mi 'debs pa /
translated: have not denigrated the noble ones,

original: yang dag par lta ba rnams te /
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba rnams te /
translated: and have had right views.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /🔽de ltar phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /🔽nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa dag gi 'gro ba drug tu @257a *//
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro // zhes bya bar rab tu shes te / de ltar phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa / nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa dag gi 'gro ba drug tu @257a *//
translated: Due to this cause and this condition, when their bodies have perished, they are reborn in a good realm, in the heavens of the higher realms.”🔽In this way, he knows perfectly the births and deaths of all beings in the six destinies in all the world systems in the ten directions, as far as the end of space,

original: gtogs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gtogs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: and throughout the realm of phenomena.

original: des kyang rlom sems su 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: des kyang rlom sems su 'gyur ba med do //
translated: and he does not become conceited because of that.

original: de ni / 'di ltar mig de mig ma yin zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir te /🔽de bdag gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar mig de mig ma yin zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir te / de bdag gis mthong ngo //
translated: Because that eye is not an eye, and is inconceivable.

original: zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not become conceited, thinking, ‘I have seen it.’🔽And why? Because that eye is not apprehended by that eye,

original: de'ang 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa dang / rang bzhin dben pa dang / rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'i mig de lta bu des mi dmigs te /🔽de ni / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par lha'i mig gi bsam pa'am /
analyzed: de'ang 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa dang / rang bzhin dben pa dang / rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'i mig de lta bu des mi dmigs te / de ni / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par lha'i mig gi bsam pa'am /
translated: because it is empty of inherent nature, because it is isolated from its inherent nature, and because it is unproduced.

original: lha'i mig mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do //
analyzed: lha'i mig mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do //
translated: And he does not even give rise to the thought of the divine eye,🔽or the thought of accomplishing the divine eye, except for the thought of the knowledge of an omniscient one.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: the bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: lha'i mig mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i mig mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: accomplishes the knowledge of the superknowledge that realizes the divine eye.

original: de ni / zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: de ni / zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: He accomplishes the superknowledge of the manifestation of the destruction of defilements, but does not attain the level of the śrāvakas or

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis thob par mi byed do //
translated: the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos kyang gang yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos kyang gang yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see any dharma that could attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de mngon par shes pa des rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thob par byas nas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu spong ba byed do //
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa des rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thob par byas nas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu spong ba byed do //
translated: Having attained the vajra-like samādhi through that superknowledge, he abandons all the latent afflictions.

original: @257b zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba mngon par shes pa des rlom sems su 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: @257b zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba mngon par shes pa des rlom sems su 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become conceited about the superknowledge of the manifestation of the destruction of defilements.

original: de ni / 'di ltar ye shes de nyid ye shes ma yin zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir te /🔽de bdag gis rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar ye shes de nyid ye shes ma yin zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir te / de bdag gis rab tu shes so //
translated: Because that very knowledge is not knowledge, because it is inconceivable.

original: zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not become conceited, thinking, ‘I know that.’

original: de'ang 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa dang / rang bzhin dben pa dang / rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'i zag pa zad pa'i ye shes mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa de lta bu mi dmigs so //🔽de ni / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par zag pa zad pa'i ye shes kyi bsam pa'am /
analyzed: de'ang 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa dang / rang bzhin dben pa dang / rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i phyir gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'i zag pa zad pa'i ye shes mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa de lta bu mi dmigs so // de ni / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par zag pa zad pa'i ye shes kyi bsam pa'am /
translated: “Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom do not apprehend any transcendent perfection of wisdom, and so on, up to and including the transcendent perfection of generosity, which they might consider to be empty of inherent existence, or to be empty of inherent identity, or to be empty of an essential nature.

original: zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do //🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do // sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom do not apprehend any transcendent perfection of wisdom, and so on, up to and including the transcendent perfection of generosity, which they might consider to be empty of inherent existence, or to be empty of inherent identity, or to be empty of an essential nature.🔽“Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom do not apprehend any transcendent perfection of wisdom, and so on, up to and including the transcendent perfection of generosity, which they might consider to be empty of inherent existence, or to be empty of inherent identity, or to be empty of an essential nature.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom do not apprehend any transcendent perfection of wisdom, and so on, up to and including the transcendent perfection of generosity, which they might consider to be empty of inherent existence, or to be empty of inherent identity, or to be empty of an essential nature.🔽“Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom do not apprehend any transcendent perfection of wisdom, and so on, up to and including the transcendent perfection of generosity, which they might consider to be empty of inherent existence, or to be empty of inherent identity, or to be empty of an essential nature.🔽“Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom do not apprehend any transcendent perfection of wisdom, and so on, up to and including the transcendent perfection of generosity, which they might consider to be empty of inherent existence, or to be empty of inherent identity, or to be empty

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod cing /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that

original: mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
translated: perfect the six superknowledges

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: and increase unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,🔽it is like this:

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas @258a *//
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas @258a *//
translated: they stand in the perfection of giving

original: shing / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir chags pa med pa'i sems nye bar bzung bas /
analyzed: shing / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir chags pa med pa'i sems nye bar bzung bas /
translated: and, because of the emptiness that transcends extremes, with a mind free of attachment,🔽they also train in the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do; ;sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do; ;sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: “In the same way, Śāradvatī­putra, when great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom abide in the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline,

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir ltung ba bya ba med pa nye bar bzung bas /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir ltung ba bya ba med pa nye bar bzung bas /
translated: they train in the path to omniscience by apprehending the absence of any transgression, on account of the emptiness of the unlimited.🔽“Śāradvatī­putra, there are some great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom and abide in the transcendent perfection of tolerance,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do // sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: they train in the path to omniscience by apprehending the absence of agitation, on account of the emptiness of the unlimited.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, there are some great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom and abide in the transcendent perfection of perseverance,

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir mi 'khrug pa nye bar bzung bas /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir mi 'khrug pa nye bar bzung bas /
translated: they train in the path to omniscience by apprehending the absence of weariness, on account of the emptiness of the unlimited.🔽“Śāradvatī­putra, there are some great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom and abide in the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: they train in the path to omniscience by apprehending the absence of distraction, on account of the emptiness of the unlimited.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, there are some great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom and abide in the transcendent perfection of wisdom,🔽they train in the path to omniscience by apprehending the absence of conceptual elaboration, on account of the emptiness of the unlimited.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: “There are also bodhisattva great beings who, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, abide in the perfection of perseverance.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus mi gzhig pa nye bar bzung bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus mi gzhig pa nye bar bzung bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: Because of the emptiness of the unlimited, they do not destroy physical and mental perseverance, and they train in the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' @258b sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' @258b sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: “There are also bodhisattva great beings who, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, abide in the perfection of concentration.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'khrug pa med pa'i sems nye bar bzung bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bdag kyang yod do //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'khrug pa med pa'i sems nye bar bzung bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bdag kyang yod do //
translated: Because of the emptiness of the unlimited, they do not disturb the mind, and they train in the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,🔽“There are also bodhisattva great beings who, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, abide in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: In this way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab 'chal ba'i sems mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bdag kyang yod do //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab 'chal ba'i sems mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bdag kyang yod do //
translated: “In this way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they stand in the perfection of wisdom and, because of the emptiness of the unlimited, they purify the path to the knowledge of all aspects by apprehending the nonapprehension of a mistaken mind.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de ltar na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: de ltar na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: in that case,

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa nye bar bzung ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nye bar bzung pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa nye bar bzung ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nye bar bzung pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they stand in the six perfections and, because of the emptiness of the unlimited, they purify the path to the knowledge of all aspects by apprehending the nonapprehension of coming and going and by apprehending the nonapprehension of grasping.

original: de la sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni /
translated: Regarding that, generosity

original: yongs su 'dzin pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
translated: is designated from the perspective of holding on to possessions.

original: tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni /
translated: Morality

original: tshul khrims ngan pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
translated: is designated from the perspective of holding on to immorality.

original: bzod pa ni /
analyzed: bzod pa ni /
translated: Patience

original: 'khrug pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
analyzed: 'khrug pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
translated: is designated from the perspective of holding on to agitation.

original: brtson 'grub ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grub ni /
translated: Effort

original: le lo nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
analyzed: le lo nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
translated: is designated from the perspective of holding on to laziness.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: Concentration

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
translated: is designated from the perspective of holding on to non-equipoise.

original: shes rab ni /
analyzed: shes rab ni /
translated: Wisdom

original: shes rab 'chal ba nye bar bzung ba las gdags te /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba nye bar bzung ba las gdags te /
translated: is designated from the perspective of holding on to bad wisdom.
Regarding that,

original: rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: there is no conceit that thinks, “I have crossed.”

original: ma rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: ma rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: There is no conceit that thinks, “I have not crossed.”

original: sbyin pa byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: There is no conceit that thinks, “I give.”

original: sbyin pa mi byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do; ;tshul khrims dang ldan no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa mi byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do; ;tshul khrims dang ldan no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: There is no conceit that thinks, “I do not give.” There is no conceit that thinks, “I am moral.”

original: tshul khrims ngan pa can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: There is no conceit that thinks, “I am immoral.”

original: bzod pa phun sum tshogs so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: bzod pa phun sum tshogs so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I am endowed with patience.’

original: khro ba can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽brtson 'grus brtsams pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: khro ba can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // brtson 'grus brtsams pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I am angry.’🔽they do not falsely project, ‘I am energetic.’

original: le lo can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽mnyam par bzhag pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: le lo can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // mnyam par bzhag pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I am lazy.’🔽they do not falsely project, ‘I am in equipoise.’

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽shes rab dang ldan no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // shes rab dang ldan no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I am not in equipoise.’🔽they do not falsely project, ‘I am wise.’

original: shes rab 'chal pa can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I am unwise.’🔽they do not falsely project, ‘I have reviled.’

original: phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽rim gro byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // rim gro byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I have bowed down.’🔽they do not falsely project, ‘I have served.’

original: rim gro ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: rim gro ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I have not served.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu; ma skyes pa ni /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu; ma skyes pa ni /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, it is because the unborn

original: spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I have reviled them.’

original: phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽rim gro byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // rim gro byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I have bowed down to them.’🔽they do not falsely project, ‘I have honored them.’

original: rim gro ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: rim gro ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I have not honored them.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why, it is because

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: this perfection of wisdom

original: rlom sems thams cad yang dag par gcod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rlom sems thams cad yang dag par gcod pa'i phyir te /
translated: cuts through all false projections.

original: 'di la sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: 'di la sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems @259b dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe yon tan ji snyed cig yod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems @259b dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe yon tan ji snyed cig yod pa de dag ni /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom have as many good qualities

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med de /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med de /
translated: as are not possessed by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de yon tan 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par byed ba'i tshe sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: de yon tan 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par byed ba'i tshe sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: When they perfect those good qualities, they also bring beings to maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
translated: and they also purify a buddhafield.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par byed do //
translated: and also attain omniscience.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems bskyed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems bskyed de /
translated: “Moreover, Śāradvatīputra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they generate a mind that is impartial toward all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed nas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed nas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: Having generated a mind that is impartial toward all sentient beings, they attain the sameness of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob nas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sems can thams cad rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob nas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sems can thams cad rab tu 'god do //
translated: Having attained the sameness of all phenomena, they establish all sentient beings in the sameness of all phenomena.

original: de ni / tshe 'di nyid la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs su byon cing dben par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni / tshe 'di nyid la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs su byon cing dben par bya ba yin te /
translated: In this very life they are approved of and secluded by the blessed buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang yid du 'ong zhing dben par bya ba yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang yid du 'ong zhing dben par bya ba yin /
translated: They are also approved of and secluded by all bodhisattvas, all śrāvakas, and all pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ni / skye ba gang dang gang du skyes kyang de dang de dag tu nam yang mig gis yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ni / skye ba gang dang gang du skyes kyang de dang de dag tu nam yang mig gis yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs mi mthong ngo //
translated: Wherever he is born, there he never sees with his eyes forms that are unpleasant.

original: rna bas yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra mi thos so //🔽snas yid du mi 'ong ba'i dri mi tshor ro //
analyzed: rna bas yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra mi thos so // snas yid du mi 'ong ba'i dri mi tshor ro //
translated: He never hears with his ears sounds that are unpleasant.🔽He never smells with his nose smells that are unpleasant.

original: lces yid du mi 'ong ba'i ro mi myong ngo //
analyzed: lces yid du mi 'ong ba'i ro mi myong ngo //
translated: He never tastes with his tongue tastes that are unpleasant.

original: lus kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i reg bya mi reg go /
analyzed: lus kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i reg bya mi reg go /
translated: He never touches with his body tactile objects that are unpleasant.

original: yid kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos rnam par rig pa med do //
analyzed: yid kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos rnam par rig pa med do //
translated: He never cognizes with his mind dharmas that are unpleasant.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems @260a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems @260a *//
translated: the bodhisattva

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in this way🔽will not regress from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Subhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe dge slong sum brgyas gos gyon gyon pa bcom ldan 'das la yon du gsol te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe dge slong sum brgyas gos gyon gyon pa bcom ldan 'das la yon du gsol te /
translated: When this teaching of the perfection of wisdom was taught, three hundred monks offered their robes to the Blessed One as a gift,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: and they gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: Then, at that time, the Blessed One smiled.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas bus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de log sa su thal mo sbyar bas btud de bcom ldan 'das la
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas bus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de log sa su thal mo sbyar bas btud de bcom ldan 'das la
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined,

original: 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni /
translated: the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
translated: do not smile without cause or condition.

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis zhal 'dzum pa mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis zhal 'dzum pa mdzad /
translated: What is the cause, what is the condition for your smile?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: dge slong sum brgya po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: dge slong sum brgya po 'di dag ni /
translated: these three hundred monks

original: bskal pa drug cu rtsa gcig 'das nas bskal pa dpe skad ma lta bu la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dpal chen po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bskal pa drug cu rtsa gcig 'das nas bskal pa dpe skad ma lta bu la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dpal chen po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
translated: will appear in the world sixty-one eons from now, during the eon called Like the Moon, as thus-gone ones, worthy ones, perfect buddhas called Mahāśrī.

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: They will

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par @260b rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi sgul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye'o //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par @260b rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi sgul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye'o //
translated: be reborn in the buddhafield of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Akṣobhya after they die here.

original: 'dod pa la spyod pa'i lha'i bu stong phrag drug cus kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: 'dod pa la spyod pa'i lha'i bu stong phrag drug cus kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: Sixty thousand sons of gods who enjoy desire have also developed the mind directed toward unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byams pa mnyes par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byams pa mnyes par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will please the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Maitreya.

original: de nyid du rab tu byung nas tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid du rab tu byung nas tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: They will go forth in his teaching and practice the holy life.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa des kyang de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ro //🔽de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus de'i tshe 'khor bzhi po de dag ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa des kyang de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ro // de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus de'i tshe 'khor bzhi po de dag ni /
translated: And the Tathāgata Maitreya will prophesy their unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di na 'khod bzhin du shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //🔽lho phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'di na 'khod bzhin du shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to // lho phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
translated: Then, through the Buddha’s power, the fourfold assembly saw, in the eastern direction, a thousand buddhas in other world systems.🔽They saw, in the southern direction, a thousand buddhas in other world systems.

original: nub phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //🔽byang phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to // byang phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
translated: They saw, in the western direction, a thousand buddhas in other world systems.🔽They saw, in the northern direction, a thousand buddhas in other world systems.

original: byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
translated: They saw, in the northeastern direction, a thousand buddhas in other world systems.

original: shar lho'i phyogs mtshams kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //🔽lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: shar lho'i phyogs mtshams kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to // lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
translated: he saw a thousand buddhas in the southeast;🔽he saw a thousand buddhas in the southwest;

original: nub byang gi phyogs mtshams kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //🔽'og gi phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: nub byang gi phyogs mtshams kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to // 'og gi phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
translated: he saw a thousand buddhas in the northwest;🔽he saw a thousand buddhas below;

original: steng gi phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //🔽'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba gang ji lta bur mthong ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba de dag ni /🔽mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi @261a *//
analyzed: steng gi phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to // 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba gang ji lta bur mthong ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba de dag ni / mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi @261a *//
translated: and he saw a thousand buddhas above.🔽He saw the arrays of qualities of the buddha realms of those lord buddhas in those world systems.

original: khams 'di ni yod par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: khams 'di ni yod par ma mthong ngo //
translated: But he did not see the array of qualities of the buddha realm of this Sahā world system.

original: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas srog chags stong phrag bcus bdag cag gis las gang byas pas /
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas srog chags stong phrag bcus bdag cag gis las gang byas pas /
translated: Then ten thousand beings in the assembly said, “What karma did we create

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i las spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i las spyod par bya'o //
translated: I will practice in such a way that I will be reborn in those buddha-fields.

original: zhes smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: zhes smon lam btab bo //
translated: Thus he made his aspiration.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: Then the Bhagavān, knowing the thoughts that were in the minds of those sons of a good family, smiled.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose up from his seat,

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das gang na de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das gang na de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: removed his robe from one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground, bowed to the Bhagavān with his palms together, and said this to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: the bhagavān buddhas

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
translated: do not smile without a cause or a reason.🔽What is the cause, what is the reason for your smile?

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis zhal 'dzum pa mdzad; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis zhal 'dzum pa mdzad; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Bhagavān said,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag mthong ngam /
translated: do you see these ten thousand beings?🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, Blessed One,🔽I see them.

original: mthong ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; dga' bo /
analyzed: mthong ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; dga' bo /
translated: The Blessed One said, Nanda,

original: srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag na /
analyzed: srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag na /
translated: among these ten thousand living beings,

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: after they die here, they will be reborn in those buddha-fields.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang yang nam du'ang mi 'bral te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang yang nam du'ang mi 'bral te /
translated: They will never be separated from the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: phyi ma'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rgyan gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba sha @261b stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rgyan gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba sha @261b stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the future, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One will appear in the world named Alamkakusuma.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa moongga la chen po'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dang / tshe dang ldan pa bshes pa'i bu gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang /

translated: Then the Venerable Shariputra, the Venerable Maha Maudgalyayana, the Venerable Subhuti, the Venerable Purna Maitrayaniputra, the Venerable Maha Kasyapa,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; 'di lta ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thug pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thug pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: It is the unlimited perfection.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽shes rab kyi pha @263a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / shes rab kyi pha @263a *//
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this perfection of wisdom

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ngo //🔽yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ngo // yongs su gtong ngo //

original: yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur to // yongs su rdzogs so //

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will be completed.

original: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob par gyur to //

analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro // de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos 'di lta ste /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par gyur to //
translated: the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzugs thob par gyur to //

analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i 'du shes thob par gyur to //
translated: they attained the perception that is equal to the unequaled;

analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i 'du byed thob par gyur to //

analyzed: ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad pas /
