translated: are to be revered by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.”

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos chen po de dag thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che po de dag thams cad la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos chen po de dag thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che po de dag thams cad la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this had been said, the Blessed One said to all those great hearers and all those bodhisattva great beings, “Excellent!

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Sons of noble family,

original: de de bzhin no //🔽de de @265b bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin no // de de @265b bzhin te /
translated: it is just so!

original: ji skad du smras pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa dag ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who practice this perfection of wisdom

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
translated: are worthy of homage from the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yod na /
translated: If there were no bodhisattva great beings,

original: mi'i 'jig rten 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the human world would not appear in the world.

original: lha'i 'jig rten 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i 'jig rten 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The world of gods would not appear in the world.

original: rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The great and high families of the kṣatriyas would not appear in the world.

original: bram ze che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bram ze che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The great and high families of the brahmins would not appear in the world.

original: khyim bdag che zhing mtho po'i rigs dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag che zhing mtho po'i rigs dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro;/
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro;/
translated: the appearance in the world of the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm;

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the appearance in the world of the gods of the Trayas­triṃśa realm;

original: mtshe ma'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽dga' ldan gyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshe ma'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // dga' ldan gyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the appearance in the world of the gods of the Yāma realm;🔽the appearance in the world of the gods of the Tuṣita realm;

original: 'phrul dga'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phrul dga'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ri // tshangs ris kyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // tshangs lha nye phan gyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the appearance in the world of the gods of the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realm;🔽the appearance in the world of the gods of the Brahmakāyika realm;🔽the appearance in the world of the gods of the Brahmapurohita realm;

original: tshangs pa kun 'khor gyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa kun 'khor gyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the appearance in the world of the gods of the Brahmapārṣadya realm;

original: tshangs chen gyi lha rnams 'jig rten du @266a *//🔽'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽snang ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs chen gyi lha rnams 'jig rten du @266a *// 'byung bar 'gyur ro // snang ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: chung snang gi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽tshad med snang ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung snang gi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // tshad med snang ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the Parīttābha gods will appear in the world.🔽the Apramāṇābha gods will appear in the world.

original: kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽dge ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // dge ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the Ābhāsvara gods will appear in the world.🔽the Śubhakṛtsna gods will appear in the world.

original: chung dge'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung dge'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the Apramāṇaśubha gods will appear in the world.

original: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽che ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // che ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the Śubhakṛtsna gods will appear in the world.🔽the Bṛhatphala gods will appear in the world.

original: chung che'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung che'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the Parīttaśubha gods will appear in the world.

original: tshad med che ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad med che ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the gods of the Mahābrahmā realm appear in the world;

original: mi che ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽mi gdung ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi che ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // mi gdung ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: shin tu mthong ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the gods of the Ābhāsvara realm appear in the world;🔽the gods of the Parīttaśubha realm appear in the world;🔽the gods of the Apramāṇaśubha realm appear in the world;

original: 'og min gyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og min gyi lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the stream enterers appear in the world;

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽phyir mi 'ong ba rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // phyir mi 'ong ba rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams 'jig rten du @266b 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the pratyekabuddhas appear in the world;

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas appear in the world.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Noble sons,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yod na /
translated: if there are bodhisattva-mahāsattvas,

analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / mal cha dang / khyim dang / 'tsho ba dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang /
translated: food and drink, vehicles, clothing, bedding, houses, livelihoods, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, corals,

analyzed: gser dang / dngul dag kyang 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: gold, and silver appear in the world.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Noble sons,

analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bde ba'i yo byad mi'i rkyen dang / lha rdzas su bya ba'am /

analyzed: yang dag par bral pa'i bde ba'ang rung ste /

analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yod na /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag / byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: Noble sons,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas te /
translated: when bodhisattvas practice bodhisattva activity, they abide in the six perfections

original: bdag sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing gzhan yang sbyin pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: bdag sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing gzhan yang sbyin pa la sbyor ro //
translated: and, while giving, they also connect others to generosity.

original: bdag tshul khrims srung zhing gzhan yang tshul khrims la sbyor ro //🔽bdag bzod pa sgom zhing gzhan yang bzod pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: bdag tshul khrims srung zhing gzhan yang tshul khrims la sbyor ro // bdag bzod pa sgom zhing gzhan yang bzod pa la sbyor ro //
translated: While guarding morality, they also connect others to morality.🔽While cultivating patience, they also connect others to patience.

original: bdag brtson 'grus rtsom zhing gzhan yang brtson 'grus la sbyor ro //🔽bdag bsam gtan skyed cing gzhan yang @267a *//
analyzed: bdag brtson 'grus rtsom zhing gzhan yang brtson 'grus la sbyor ro // bdag bsam gtan skyed cing gzhan yang @267a *//
translated: While undertaking perseverance, they also connect others to perseverance.

original: bsam gtan la sbyor ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sbyor ro //
translated: While generating concentration, they also connect others to concentration.

original: bdag shes rab sgom zhing gzhan yang shes rab sgom pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: bdag shes rab sgom zhing gzhan yang shes rab sgom pa la sbyor ro //
translated: While cultivating wisdom, they also connect others to the cultivation of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten cing sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten cing sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod de /
translated: Relying on the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, sentient beings practice the six perfections.

original: de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pas /
analyzed: de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pas /
translated: By practicing the six perfections,

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'thob bo //
translated: they attain all mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Noble sons,

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: therefore

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du zhugs pa yin no //
translated: are engaged in the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di khyab par mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di khyab par mdzad do //
translated: Then the Bhagavān, at that time, extended his tongue and covered this entire three-million-fold world system with it.

original: de nas de'i tshe ljags kyi dbang po de las 'od 'phro ba kha dog du ma dang / kha dog sna tshogs su ldan pa mang po byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe ljags kyi dbang po de las 'od 'phro ba kha dog du ma dang / kha dog sna tshogs su ldan pa mang po byung bar gyur to //
translated: Then, at that time, from his tongue many lights of various colors and various arrays issued forth.

original: de byung nas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //🔽lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: de byung nas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to // lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
translated: When that light appeared, the world systems in the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, became filled with great light.🔽The world systems in the southern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, became filled with great light.

original: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //🔽byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //🔽byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i @267b klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to // byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to // byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i @267b klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
translated: The world systems in the western direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, became filled with great light.🔽The world systems in the northern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, became filled with great light.🔽The world systems in the northeastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, became filled with great light.

original: shar lho'i phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: shar lho'i phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen rgyas par gyur to //
translated: The world systems in the southeastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, became filled with great light.

original: lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
translated: the worlds in the southwest,

original: nub byang gi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //🔽'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: nub byang gi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to // 'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
translated: the worlds in the northwest,🔽the worlds below,

original: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
translated: and the worlds above were suffused with a great light.

original: de nas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag gi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis 'od rnam par phye ba de mthong nas rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: de nas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag gi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis 'od rnam par phye ba de mthong nas rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattvas in the eastern direction, in worlds numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, saw that radiance, and they each asked their own buddhas,🔽“Bhagavān, what are the causes, what are the roots of virtue,

original: la zhus te /
analyzed: la zhus te /
translated: and asked him.🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: and asked, Bhagavat,

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dag snang ba chen pos gtams pa 'di su'i mthu lags zhes yongs su dris so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dag snang ba chen pos gtams pa 'di su'i mthu lags zhes yongs su dris so //
translated: whose power is it that these world systems are filled with a great light?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Those buddha bhagavats said,

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Sons of noble family,

original: 'di ni / nub phyogs logs na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /
analyzed: 'di ni / nub phyogs logs na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /
translated: in the western direction there is a world system called Saha.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bdag cag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gang brnyes par gyur pa'i chos kyi rnam pa de lta bu thams cad thob par gyur te nyan thos kyi dge 'dun 'di lta bu ni /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gang brnyes par gyur pa'i chos kyi rnam pa de lta bu thams cad thob par gyur te nyan thos kyi dge 'dun 'di lta bu ni /
translated: in the future, we too will attain all the aspects of the Dharma that the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One has attained, and we will gather a saṅgha of disciples just like this.

original: yongs su bsdu bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsdu bar bgyi'o //
translated: We will gather them.

original: da ltar 'dir de bzhin gshegs pas chos ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du 'khor 'di dang 'dra bar ni chos bstan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: da ltar 'dir de bzhin gshegs pas chos ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du 'khor 'di dang 'dra bar ni chos bstan par bgyi'o //
translated: Just as the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma here now, we will teach the Dharma in the same way to a retinue just like this.”

original: zhes smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: zhes smon lam btab bo //
translated: They made this aspiration.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de chos thams cad la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa la bzod par gyur pa mkhyen nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de chos thams cad la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa la bzod par gyur pa mkhyen nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts of those sons of noble family, and knowing that they had attained acceptance of the non-arising of all phenomena, the non-cessation of all phenomena, the absence of mental formations, and the absence of origination, smiled.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /

original: bcom ldan 'das /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:🔽Subhūti, you are always attentive to the bodhisattva great beings and expound their perfection of generosity.

original: rab 'byor / khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te /
translated: Subhuti, you should generate the eloquence to give a Dharma discourse to the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, beginning with the perfection of wisdom,

original: ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos kyi gtam bya bar spobs pa skyed cig /
analyzed: ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos kyi gtam bya bar spobs pa skyed cig /
translated: in such a way that the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas will emerge from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam ste /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, the great hearers, and the sons of gods thought this:🔽“Is the Venerable Subhuti teaching the perfection of wisdom to the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas with the power and force of his own wisdom and eloquence alone,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di rang gi shes rab dang / spobs pa tsam gyi stobs dang / shugs kyi go chas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston tam @273b 'on te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di rang gi shes rab dang / spobs pa tsam gyi stobs dang / shugs kyi go chas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston tam @273b 'on te /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, is it just through the power and force of his own wisdom and eloquence that he teaches the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings?

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus ston par 'gyur snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag gis sems kyi kun tu rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la smras pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus ston par 'gyur snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag gis sems kyi kun tu rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la smras pa /
translated: Then, through the Buddha's power, the venerable Subhuti, knowing the thoughts that were in the minds of those bodhisattvas, those great disciples, and those gods, said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams ni /
translated: the disciples of the Lord

original: gang ci smra'ang rung /🔽gang ci ston kyang rung /
analyzed: gang ci smra'ang rung / gang ci ston kyang rung /
translated: whatever they may say,🔽whatever they may teach,

original: gang ci rjod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gang ci rjod kyang rung ste /
translated: whatever they may explain,

original: de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
translated: all that is the power of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang bstan pa de thams cad kyang chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang bstan pa de thams cad kyang chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: And whatever Dharma the Tathagata teaches, all that is not contrary to the true nature of dharmas.

original: de ltar rigs kyi bu de dag ni /
analyzed: de ltar rigs kyi bu de dag ni /
translated: Thus, noble sir,

original: chos bstan pa de la slob cing chos nyid de lta bu mngon du byed do //
analyzed: chos bstan pa de la slob cing chos nyid de lta bu mngon du byed do //
translated: They train in that Dharma teaching and actualize that reality.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs kyis ston pa mdzad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs kyis ston pa mdzad kyi /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ni /

original: chos su btags pa de la 'di lta ste /

analyzed: chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /

original: nang na'ang med /

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du gang 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba dag kyang chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /🔽chos su btags pa de la 'di lta ste /

translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, this so-called perfection of wisdom, this so-called bodhisattva, and this so-called name of a bodhisattva are simply imputations as phenomena.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya bar ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /

translated: That imputation as a phenomenon is neither produced nor does it cease, apart from being verbally and conventionally designated by the term ‘perfection of wisdom’, by the term ‘bodhisattva’, and by the term ‘name of a bodhisattva’.

original: ming de ni /
analyzed: ming de ni /
translated: That name

original: nang na'ang med /

analyzed: ming tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ste / mgo'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / mjing pa'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / phrag pa'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / dpung pa'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang /
translated: is merely a name, designated by conventional term.🔽It is designated by the conventional term ‘skull,’ ‘neck bone,’ ‘shoulder bone,’ ‘arm bone,’🔽‘wrist bone,’ ‘hand bone,’ ‘hip bone,’ ‘thigh bone,’

original: tshigs pa'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / rtsib ma'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / dpyi'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / brla'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang /
analyzed: tshigs pa'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / rtsib ma'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / dpyi'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / brla'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang /
translated: ‘shin bone,’ ‘ankle bone,’ ‘foot bone,’ and so on.

original: rje ngar gyi rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / rkang pa'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa de dag kyang chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: rje ngar gyi rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa dang / rkang pa'i rus pa zhes ming du tha snyad kyis gdags pa de dag kyang chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: The designation of the bones of the head, the designation of the bones of the neck, the designation of the bones of the shoulders, the designation of the bones of the arms, the designation of the bones of the hands, the designation of the bones of the ribs, the designation of the bones of the spine, the designation of the bones of the thighs, the designation of the bones of the calves, and the designation of the bones of the feet are all just designations of phenomena.

original: chos su btags pa de la 'di lta ste /🔽mgo'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / mjing pa'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / phrag pa'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / dpung pa'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / tshigs pa'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / rtsib ma'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la 'di lta ste / mgo'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / mjing pa'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / phrag pa'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / dpung pa'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / tshigs pa'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / rtsib ma'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: The designation of phenomena is as follows:

original: dpyi'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / brla'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / rje ngar gyi rus pa zhes bya ba dang / rkang pa'i rus pa zhes bya bar ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: dpyi'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / brla'i rus pa zhes bya ba dang / rje ngar gyi rus pa zhes bya ba dang / rkang pa'i rus pa zhes bya bar ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: the so-called bones of the head, the so-called bones of the neck, the so-called bones of the shoulders, the so-called bones of the arms, the so-called bones of the hands, the so-called bones of the ribs, the so-called bones of the spine, the so-called bones of the thighs, the so-called bones of the calves, and the so-called bones of the feet are all just designations by way of names and symbols. Apart from that, they are neither produced nor do they cease.

original: ming de ni /🔽nang na'ang med /

translated: They do not consider the compound ‘contact at the eye’ to arise.🔽They do not consider the compound ‘contact at the eye’ to cease.🔽They do not consider the compound ‘contact at the eye’ to be isolated.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba mi dben par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba mi dben par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba dge bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

translated: They do not view the contact at the eye as virtuous or non-virtuous.🔽They do not view the contact at the eye as blameworthy or not blameworthy.🔽They do not view the contact at the eye as compounded or uncompounded.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba mi dge bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

translated: They do not view the contact at the eye as calm or not calm.🔽They do not view the contact at the eye as empty or not empty.🔽They do not view the contact at the eye as with signs or signless.🔽They do not view the contact at the eye as having aspirations or lacking aspirations.

translated: They do not view the contact at the eye as afflicted or purified.🔽They do not view the contact at the eye as arising or ceasing.🔽They do not view the contact at the eye as being with defilement or being without defilement.🔽They do not view the contact at the eye as being with afflictions or being without afflictions.🔽They do not view the contact at the eye as being something to be relinquished or being something to be actualized.
